head.title: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:preserve-space

meta.name: title
meta.content: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: xsl:preserve-space

body.p: The xsl:preserve-space element is used at the top level of the stylesheet to define elements in the source document for which white-space nodes are significant and should be retained.

The elements attribute is mandatory, and defines a space-separated list of element names. The value "*" may be used to mean "all elements"; in this case any elements where whitespace is not to be preserved may be indicated by an xsl:strip-space element.
